name: places/ChIJS0wdM_xYwokR6__S8Z36Gl8
formattedAddress: 333 E 56th St 1ST FLOOR, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 333 E 56th St 1ST FLOOR, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
I currently receive treatment at Dr. William L. King’s office at NYC Orthopedic Group at 2044 Ocean Ave, Brooklyn location. Here are some things I’ve experienced:
I have never seen Dr. King in his office until I had surgery on 9/10. I’ve seen several of his PAs, but they are never the same.
His staff has poor communication and is dismissive. They will give unnecessary run around in reaching Christina, who seems to be the person responsible for providing documentation.
Staff will call to ask to come in earlier than the scheduled appointment time when coming in for a 3:30 p.m. or 4 p.m. appointment, although business closes at 5 p.m. Sometimes, I come from work and would do a half day to go in at those times.
Staff will cancel appointments without relaying that information to local office and schedule you for appointments without letting you know.
Admin staff refused to provide the documentation required for employment leave after two weeks of trying to obtain this document. I had to get my lawyers involved, who were also given the runaround. I eventually received the letter through my lawyer one week later, which was insufficient for my job and needed revision. Again, the revised note took one week to receive and was submitted to my lawyer. Remember this is through email, not snail mail (a total of three weeks).
When calling for a post-operative appointment, the system was down. It happens, I understand, but an appointment was made without me being aware until I called and was informed I had an appointment. My issue with this is that had I not called. I wouldn’t have been aware until the last minute.
After my post-operative appointment on 9/19, nine days after surgery, I received a letter the next day from Valeria, which had incorrect dates and looked thrown together. I responded to her email explaining that the PA discussed extending my leave, following up in four weeks and speaking to Christina, who is in charge of documentation, and I should get this done right away. Valeria called me the following morning, and I explained further the overlap of my return to duty date (10/10) and next follow-up appointment which would fall on 10/17. She stated I couldn’t get an extension without coming in disregarding medical professionals directives.
In person no issues but anything over the phone is a nightmare. No documentation is given at the office location everything is done verbally.
Dr. King seems like a pleasant doctor; I spoke to him before and after surgery. He did keep me informed and assured me I would get a revised letter on my surgery date (that didn’t happen). His staff's poor communication and lack of regard overshadow his business. I wouldn’t recommend anyone seek treatment with this doctor or his establishment. It seems like other reviewers have encountered similar situations as I did. Do better and work on improving patient services and training of administrative staff members. Also, it would be beneficial that the PA communicates with admin staff or chart patient leave so the patient does not have to advocate profusely.

originalText.text: Great Dr but horrible staff. I had a warm time getting documents after I did surgery with him. No one has information and no one can assist you. Everyone was nice and polite before I did surgery but after surgery I was on my own. I regret going to this office.

text.text: Great Dr but horrible staff. I had a warm time getting documents after I did surgery with him. No one has information and no one can assist you. Everyone was nice and polite before I did surgery but after surgery I was on my own. I regret going to this office.

originalText.text: I saw Dr King several years ago for a dislocated finger. He was concerned that it might need surgery to correct and as he was going on vacation, he sent me to a friend who was close by and could see me that day. That orthopedist was able to put it back in.  Fast forward 4 years and my son broke one of the metacarpal bones in his hand. As soon as he saw the X-rays he knew it would need to be surgically corrected.  He performed surgery 6 days later.  Everything went super smooth.  NYU orthopedics is beyond wonderful! He just went for his follow up and so far so good. The ladies in his office are superb and we never wait long.  I highly recommend Dr William King.

originalText.text: Amazing doctor but bad work ethic and professionalism from front desk & administration staff. I saw the PA she’s amazing, and a patient coordinator named Christina  (not a licensed medical professional) changed the plan of care she had for me. I never went back it scared me to have someone not licensed to make decisions about my health she is not a MD,  not a PA and not a NP I went for a second opinion and this new doc disagreed with her letter and so the IME doctor.

originalText.text:
Dr. King has been around for a long time. Highly experienced, no red tape. I broke my dominant hand on the job in 2017. Health Services gave me a runaround about whether or not I needed surgery (it was obvious I did). The nurse recommended Dr. King. I was able to get a same-day appointment, Dr. King waited for me longer than he had to, and within an hour I had a surgical appointment for 2 weeks later. Worker's Comp info be damned, Helen said don't worry about it, she knew how NYC worked.

The surgery went off without a hitch. Dr. King was outstanding and he really helped clarify everything that was going on. Helen was amazingly patient with her efforts to get the workers comp people in line.

I ended up having a second surgery for carpal tunnel syndrome related to the fracture 3 years later. Normally you'd have no chance getting something like that attached to the original case, but not with Dr. King's staff. They were able to get everything tied together and there were no missed steps. My comp case is nearing settlement and though I do have some loss of use, it's a trade-off for such great care.

I was pleasantly surprised at how good Dr. King was. I have recommended him to several friends and coworkers. He's a rare find in the complicated field orthopedic surgery.
